chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Samuel M. Serene was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for any administrative suspension.
AODA and comply with a driver safety plan.

timeConds.notes: One year confinement as a condition of probation, to be served in La Crosse County Jail pursuant to the direction of the Sheriff, with credit for 47 days previously served.  Report for jail no later than 5:00 p.m. on October 12, 2016, but may begin sooner if Sheriff can accomodate earlier report date.

Letter from D.H. on behalf of Sam Serene.
Sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion for Continuance of the sentencing hearing.  As grounds, defendant asserts he would like a private PSI.

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hillestad requests defendant be released on bond, eligible for bond awaiting sentence.  Atty Hillestad informs he filed a motion for continuance to request private PSI.  State has no objection to continuance, if released on bond requests $2500 cash bond and if post be on alcohol monitoring, no drink, no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court refers to scheduling clerk to reschedule sentencing hrg. @ 60 days out.  Court reinstates bond previously ordered, with cash of $5000 or alcohol monitoring.
Motion hearing on April 19, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Letter from P.W. in reference to Sam.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bond
Letter/Correspondence
Letter received from Samuel Serene.  Copies provided to counsel.
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion
Letter from Tomah VA Medical Center re: Samuel Serene

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court advises defendant of charge in count 1/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and  finds defendant guilty of OWI 6th offense w/minor child passenger.  Court orders PSI and counsel to see scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.  Defendant remanded to the Pepin County Jail immediately.  Atty Hillestad requests huber for health needs and placement with minor child.  Court authorizes release for purposes of medical care, no release for child placement.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-08-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and constitutional rights. Also citation for failure to keep vehicle under control.  NGP entered.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Arraignment at 01-19-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint filed adding PAC.    Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  Waiver of Preliminary done on the record with counsel to supplement record with waiver form.  Subject to WOPH, bind defendant over for trial.  DA to file Information and counsel to set Arraignment, track traffic.
Order Denying Administrative Suspension.
Motion to Stay Administration Suspension Pending Judicial Review.
Request for Judicial Review

Adjourned initial appearance at 11-16-2015 01:15 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-03-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant continues to waive time limits for prelim. hrg.  Atty Hillestad informs the court Mr. Serene entering a residential treatment program in early August with discharge date late September.  Court modifies bond to suspend alcohol monitoring during the period he's in treatment. Referred to scheduling clerk.
Attorney Roger M. Hillestad has been retained.

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informs the court he has retained Atty Roger Hillestad who can't be here today.  Court considers defendant unrepresented until we hear from Atty Hillestad he represents you.  Matter cont'd.  Bond continued as previously set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant released on Signature Bond - Alcohol Monitoring Program Agreement attached.

Defendant Samuel M. Serene in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a prelim. hrg.  State requests $2,500 Cash Bond with conditions: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no operating a motor vehicle without valid license. Would allow a signature bond with VICAP unit. Court sets bond at $2,500 cash with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no operating a motor vehicle without valid license or insurance. As an alternative, if you make arrangements to be on an alcohol monitoring unit,(VICAP) that tests twice a day the court would allow a signature bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 07, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
